page.title: 11 The A1 Trunk Road
page.content: The A1 trunk road is part of the national motorway network.Where it passes by Stotfold going North it was once part of the Great North Roman Rd. {It is used by > 20,000 vehicles a day. { }Travelling north from the Stotfold, Baldock roundabout towards Biggleswade the land is mainly agricultural land used for{market gardening.}There is a large nursery with 4\ acres under glass.2\ million lettuce are grown yearly to supply supermarket chains. The area to the east of the A1 between Taylors Rd & Wrayfields Rd.has a Little Chef cafe & garage.A large breakdown depot was also proposed for this site but was rejected in 1984. On the south bound route there is a petrol stn. & a boarding kennels. {The Tudor Oaks coaching house (a hotel {&}discoteque)is opposite this.
